title: Dermoscopy Mode
subtitle: Enhanced Analysis for Dermatoscope Images
dermoscopyDescription: Dermoscopy (also called dermatoscopy or epiluminescence microscopy) is a non-invasive diagnostic technique that allows in vivo evaluation of skin lesion colors and structures not visible to the naked eye.
accuracyImprovement: Studies show dermoscopy improves melanoma detection accuracy by 20-30% compared to naked eye examination alone.
magnificationDescription: Typically 10x to 100x magnification reveals subsurface structures
illuminationDescription: Polarized or non-polarized light eliminates surface reflection
patternAnalysisDescription: AI analyzes colors, structures, and patterns invisible to naked eye
structuresSubtitle: Our AI automatically detects and analyzes these features:
pigmentNetworkDescription: Net-like pigmented lines indicating melanocyte distribution
dotsGlobulesDescription: Small circular melanin structures indicating cell clusters
blueWhiteVeilDescription: Important melanoma indicator showing deeper melanin deposits
radialStreaksDescription: Linear structures at lesion periphery suggesting growth
vascularPatternsDescription: Blood vessel structures helping differentiate lesion types
regressionStructuresDescription: Areas of healing or melanin loss indicating changes
tip1Description: Requires specialized device or smartphone attachment (e.g., DermLite, Handyscope, iDerma)
tip2Description: Place device flush against skin for clear magnified view
tip3Description: Ensure entire lesion fits within circular field of view
tip4Description: Keep device steady for sharp, clear image of structures
tip5Description: Reduces glare and reveals deeper structures
aiAnalysisDescription: When you upload a dermoscopy image, our AI system automatically:
feature1: Detects dermoscopy image characteristics (circular field, polarization)
feature2: Identifies all dermoscopic structures present in the lesion
feature3: Analyzes patterns using 7-point checklist and ABCD criteria
feature4: Provides clinical significance for each detected feature
feature5: Combines with standard classification for comprehensive diagnosis
sevenPointDescription:
Major criteria: atypical network, blue-white veil, atypical vascular pattern
Minor criteria: irregular streaks, irregular dots/globules, irregular blotches, regression structures
abcdRuleDescription: Asymmetry, Border irregularity, Color variation, Dermoscopic structures
menziesMethodDescription: Negative features (symmetry of pattern, single color) and positive features (blue-white veil, multiple brown dots, etc.)
limitation1: • Dermoscopy requires training and experience to interpret correctly
limitation2: • AI analysis is a screening tool, not a definitive diagnosis
limitation3: • Some lesion types are difficult to classify even with dermoscopy
limitation4: • Always consult a dermatologist for suspicious lesions
limitation5: • Biopsy is the gold standard for melanoma diagnosis
getStartedDescription: Upload a dermoscopy image from your device or capture one using a dermatoscope attachment. The AI will automatically detect and analyze dermoscopic structures.
